reviews.text: We stayed in Mestral with our 2 children (3 year old and 11 month old). We had been recommended this accommodation and read lots of positive reviews.
reviews.title: Fantastic for young children

reviews.text: The apartment (D1) overlooked the kids splash pool and was accessed by a few steps with a gate at the top. The balcony was large with a tabe and seating for 5. Also a laundry dryer (slightly broken but we managed to prop it up).
reviews.title: great for kids but very expensive

reviews.text: This was our first visit to these apartments and to Menorca. We were a family group which included two young boys aged 6 and 8. We had asked for poolside rooms which we were given and found these ideal, especially for the children as we could keep an eye on them from the large balcony. Generally, I think the rooms could do with updating and they smelled of damp when we arrived and the fridge/freezer was rusty. The area around the pool was crammed with sunbeds, most of which were in the shade for the majority of the day. The water park was great for the kids. The apartments were spacious and the air conditioning excellent and needed. The pool bar was expensive and was not really used much.
reviews.title: Take plenty of Euros

reviews.text: The best thing about Santo Thomas is the beach, only a couple of minutes walk away. The sea was clean and warm. The restaurants in the resort all seemed to serve the same menu (apart from the one Chinese) alot of chips and nothing exciting or Spanish! If you intend on eating out take lots of euros as everything expensive. The two supermarkets is the resort are a ripoff, if you do not have a hire car it is worth getting a bus or taxi to Migjorn (10 minutes away) and stocking up there where the supermarkets are half the price.
